intro: Matelea chrysantha, commonly known as the golden matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other ornamental plants. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for xeriscaping in arid regions.
